qas.question: When did Napoleon marry Marie Louise?
What did Napoleon abolish in Spain in 1813, during his brother's rule there?

context: Napoleon was crowned Emperor Napoleon I on <a0_0>2 December 1804<a0_0/> at <a1_0>Notre Dame de Paris<a1_0/> by <a2_0>Pope Pius VII<a2_0/>. On <a3_0>1 April 1810<a3_0/>, Napoleon religiously married the Austrian princess Marie Louise. During his brother's rule in Spain, he abolished <a4_0>the Spanish Inquisition<a4_0/> in 1813. In a private discussion with general Gourgaud during his exile on Saint Helena, Napoleon expressed materialistic views on the origin of man,[note 9]and doubted the divinity of Jesus, stating that it is absurd to believe that Socrates, Plato, Muslims, and the Anglicans should be damned for not being Roman Catholics.[note 10] He also said to Gourgaud in 1817 "I like the Mohammedan religion best. It has fewer incredible things in it than ours." and that "the Mohammedan religion is the finest of all." However, Napoleon was anointed by a priest before his death.
